reviewText: I liked this story, a story of understanding the importance of family and culture.
Great buy and I would definitely buy from seller again !!!!
Loved it. When I first started watching it I thought it was a reality movie. Took a while to realize it was a regular movie.
Turquoise Rose is a good movie in that it shows how Native Americans respect their elders. It sets a good example for everyone. Turquoise grows up a lot as the story progresses.

Wow! Where are more Native American movies like this one. Made by Native Americans starring Native Americans, with different story lines.
Makes me think of movies like Skins, Christmas in the Clouds,Imprint, Four Sheets to the Wind and Edge of America.
saw the movie-glad to have my own copy
Great family movie with lots of Navajo culture.

Although there are images of Navajo life, the film is verrrrrry slow.  There is very little of the "action" that my students would want as part of any film I might show in class. (We learn about Navajo Code Talkers in WWII).
This is a fun movie to explain some of the culture of Arizona.  I sure would like a sequel.  Ethel Begay is fantastic in her role.
